reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports within 180 days; States report within 120 days
summary:
12. Eritrea must show transparency in its public finances, particularly in the mining sector.

13. States must promote vigilance in their nationals and firms doing business in Eritrea's mining sector.

14. States must introduce due diligence guidelines to prevent financial services from contributing to Eritrea's violation of resolutions.

15. States must report to the Security Council within 120 days on steps taken to implement this resolution.

16. The Monitoring Group's mandate is expanded to monitor and report on implementation of measures imposed.

17. States and UN bodies are urged to cooperate fully with the Committee and the Monitoring Group.
Affirms continuous review of Eritrea's actions, readiness to adjust measures based on compliance with resolutions 1844 (2008), 1862 (2009), 1907 (2009), and this resolution; 
Requests the Secretary-General to report on Eritrea's compliance within 180 days; 
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
